Livrinho CS Claudio Satio Amadatsu 2021-08-09 Chapter 1 Prerequisites This is a sample book written in Markdown. You can use anything that Pandocs Markdown supports, e.g., a math equation \(a^2 + b^2 = c^2\). The bookdown package can be installed from CRAN or Github: Servidor do livro: bookdown::serve_book() servr::daemon_stop(1) para parar install.packages("bookdown") # or the development version # devtools::install_github("rstudio/bookdown") Remember each Rmd file contains one and only one chapter, and a chapter is defined by the first-level heading #. To compile this example to PDF, you need XeLaTeX. You are recommended to install TinyTeX (which includes XeLaTeX): https://yihui.org/tinytex/. head(iris,20) ## Sepal.Length Sepal.Width Petal.Length Petal.Width Species ## 1 5.1 3.5 1.4 0.2 setosa ## 2 4.9 3.0 1.4 0.2 setosa ## 3 4.7 3.2 1.3 0.2 setosa ## 4 4.6 3.1 1.5 0.2 setosa ## 5 5.0 3.6 1.4 0.2 setosa ## 6 5.4 3.9 1.7 0.4 setosa ## 7 4.6 3.4 1.4 0.3 setosa ## 8 5.0 3.4 1.5 0.2 setosa ## 9 4.4 2.9 1.4 0.2 setosa ## 10 4.9 3.1 1.5 0.1 setosa ## 11 5.4 3.7 1.5 0.2 setosa ## 12 4.8 3.4 1.6 0.2 setosa ## 13 4.8 3.0 1.4 0.1 setosa ## 14 4.3 3.0 1.1 0.1 setosa ## 15 5.8 4.0 1.2 0.2 setosa ## 16 5.7 4.4 1.5 0.4 setosa ## 17 5.4 3.9 1.3 0.4 setosa ## 18 5.1 3.5 1.4 0.3 setosa ## 19 5.7 3.8 1.7 0.3 setosa ## 20 5.1 3.8 1.5 0.3 setosa knitr::kable( head(iris,20), caption = "Nice table - kable", booktabs=TRUE ) Table 1.1: Nice table - kable Sepal.Length Sepal.Width Petal.Length Petal.Width Species 5.1 3.5 1.4 0.2 setosa 4.9 3.0 1.4 0.2 setosa 4.7 3.2 1.3 0.2 setosa 4.6 3.1 1.5 0.2 setosa 5.0 3.6 1.4 0.2 setosa 5.4 3.9 1.7 0.4 setosa 4.6 3.4 1.4 0.3 setosa 5.0 3.4 1.5 0.2 setosa 4.4 2.9 1.4 0.2 setosa 4.9 3.1 1.5 0.1 setosa 5.4 3.7 1.5 0.2 setosa 4.8 3.4 1.6 0.2 setosa 4.8 3.0 1.4 0.1 setosa 4.3 3.0 1.1 0.1 setosa 5.8 4.0 1.2 0.2 setosa 5.7 4.4 1.5 0.4 setosa 5.4 3.9 1.3 0.4 setosa 5.1 3.5 1.4 0.3 setosa 5.7 3.8 1.7 0.3 setosa 5.1 3.8 1.5 0.3 setosa
